channel.description: A travel blog documenting memories and experiences from around the world

item.title: Classy Cameron Highlands
item.description: #Tea #plantation in the #cameron #highlands of #malaysia #teaplantation #teaplantations #tea #tealover #tealeaves #ipoh #bohtea #bohteaplantation

item.title: Pretty Penang
item.description: #Christmas in #georgetown #penang #malaysia #batuferringhi #penangisland #penangcafe #beachlife #crazyrichasians #asia #asiatravel #asiatrip

item.title: Impressive Ipoh
item.description: Cave temples and Ipoh - a heritage town, nestled between limestone cliffs . #cavetemple #perakcavetemple #sampohtong #kelliescastle #chinesetemple #chinese #culture #architecture #ipoh #perak #malaysia #trulyasia

item.title: Kool Kuala Lumpur
item.description: Malaysia - truly Asia. I grew up with the trivia that the #petronastowers are the tallest man-made structure in the world and visiting it was my childhood dream to say the least Now we have #merdeka118tower next to it as the world's second tallest building! #malaysia #trulyasia #kualalumpur #malay #tourism #asia # culture #chinese #buddhist #heritage

item.title: Stuck in Dallas
item.description: Christmas at Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Gardens. #christmas #botanicalgardens #gardening #25daysofchristmas #dallas #texas

item.title: Thanksgiving 22
item.description: #Thanksgiving at #mississippistate #jackson #mississippi #canton #cypressswamp #pearlriver

item.title: New Orleans
item.description: The life before dark and hangovers in New Orleans! #jacksonsquare #stlouiscemetery #cemetery #frenchquarter #cafedumonde #neworleans #neworleansfood #nola #louisiana

item.title: Marvelous Mirror Lake
item.description: Early season #snow and #frozen #lake of #mthood! #mirrorlake #portland #oregon #wilderness #winter #cold #winterishere

item.title: Yappy Yosemite
item.description: Yosemite National Park - famed for #elcapitan, #halfdome #yosemitevalley, #tunnelview train ride through #sequoia trees and #mariposagrove! #yosemite #yosemitenationalpark #nationalpark #nationalparks #california #usa

item.title: Dazzling Daytona
item.description: The home and most prestigious of the #NASCAR races - #Daytona500. #race #daytona #daytonabeach #speedway #f1 #cars #carracing #speed #staugustine #florida

item.title: Sunny St Augestine
item.description: St. Augestine - The #oldest (continuously inhabited European settled) city in the USA. #staugustine #saintaugustine #fort #castle #castillodesanmarcos #spanisharchitecture #spanish #visitflorida #florida #floridalife

item.title: Tasteful Tampa
item.description: The bay of #Tampa, and clearwater #beach! #tampabay #clearwaterbeach #sunset #nature #muralart #murals #florida #visitflorida

item.title: Everglades National Park
item.description: The large swamps of everglades national park POV #airboat and #tram #swamp #everglades #nps #evergladesnationalpark #airboats #adventuretime #nature #aligator #gators #florida

item.title: Magic Miami
item.description: South Beach Miami - a playground for people seeking sunshine and a crazy nightlife. #sunshine #beach #lifeguard #beaches #nightclub #nightlife #beachlife #southbeach #miamibeach #miami #florida

item.title: Fort Warden State Park
item.description: Coastal fortifications of the Pacific Northwest. #fortwardenstatepark #fortflaglerstatepark #fort #fortification #seattle #pacificnorthwest #pnw

item.title: Green Mountain Hike
item.description: Drive a couple hours, hike for a couple of hours, only to look back at the exact place you started the journey from. #seattle #greenmountains #hiking #pnw #lookout #adventure #washingtonstate #pacificnorthwest

item.title: Firy Fremont Lookout
item.description: #Midnight, #milkyway , #twilight and #sunrise at #mountrainier #nps #nationalpark during our first #nighthike and feeble attempt at #astrophotography. Capturing milky way is a dream come true, thanks to heatwave and ðŸ“¸: @iamnanditag @constellations.illusoires @spaceornothing #astronomy #darksky #astrophotographer #photooftheday #washingtonstate #explorewashington #pnw #pnwonderland #pnwlife #pnwadventures #pacificnorthwest #seattle #hiking

item.title: Otter Falls Hike
item.description: After #hiking close to 150km in the past two months, my knees have given up, so looking for flat hiking #recommendations. #otterfalls #snoqualmie #washington #washingtonstate #explorewashington #explore #kneeinjury

item.title: Icy Lake Ingalls
item.description: A #frozen #lake and peak #summer. #lake #freeze #snow #ice #winterinsummer #pnw #pacificnorthwest #pnw #washingtonstate #explorewashington

item.title: Hiking Heather Lake
item.description: Did a #blissful parikrama of heather lake. #heather #lake #washington #mountains #adventure #hike #trail #pacificnorthwest #pnw #seattle #washingtonstate

item.title: San Juan Islands
item.description: #Lavender #bloom, #pacific #ocean, and #ferry to #islands amongst friends from different phases of life at #sanjuanislands. #washington #washingtonstate #sanjuan #islandhopping #sea #picnic #lavendarfields #lavenderfields

item.title: Lake Serene Hike
item.description: Yet another #alpine #lake #hike, but this time with a #refreshing #waterfall bonus. #bridalveilfalls #lakeserene #adventure #hiking #washingtonstate #explorewashington #seattle #pnw #explorewashingtonstate

item.title: Charming Colchuk
item.description: Outdid ourselves by completing the 21km+ Colchuk plus Stuart #lake #trail, hoping to be back to core enchantments some day! #aasgardpass #colchucklake #stuartlake #enchantments #washington #hiking #hikingwashingtonstate #hikingadventures #adventure #washingtonstate #pacificnorthwestmountaineers #pacificnorthwest #pnw

item.title: Dirty Harry Balcony Trail
item.description: Over-looking the i90 corridor - a 10 mile stretch of an interstate with crazy amount hiking options. #dirtyharry #i90 #interstate #hike #outdoors #adventure #fernweh #trek #seattle #kingcounty #washingtonstate

item.title: Granite Lake Hike
item.description: Itâ€™s almost summer in seattle hike. #granitelake #lake #hike #adventure #travel #travelphotography #fitness #seattle #snoqualmie #washingtonstate

item.title: Mighty Mount Si
item.description: Summited my first ever mountain in the Pacific Northwest - the quintessential Mount Si. #mountsi #pacificnorthwest #pnw #pnwonderland #hikingwashingtonstate #hiking #adventure #trail #seattle #washington #washingtonstate

item.title: Hanford Reach
item.description: The not so talked about, arid, desert side of Washington on the east after you cross the cascades. #desert #cascades #hike #wildhorse #nationalmonument #columbiariver #washington #washingtonstate

item.title: Chickasaw Nation
item.description: Revisited the sad story of #chicksawnationalrecreationarea which was stripped off its national park status to see some natural #springs. Ex #plattnationalpark. #oklahoma #chicksawnation #tribal #naturalsprings #nature #adventure #springwater #sulphursprings #usa

item.title: Hot Springs NP
item.description: Hot Springs NP - An urban national park, nicknamed 'The American #Spa' #hotsprings #hotspringsarkansas #hotspringsnationalpark #nationalpark #bathhouse #arkansas #usa

item.title: Crater of Diamonds
item.description: Diamond mining. Dreamed of finding diamonds or rare earth minerals over a ex-volvano - found jaspers and random rocks instead. #diamonds #diamondtrade #craterofdiamondsstatepark #arkansas #littlerock

item.title: Happy in Houston
item.description: #Houston we have a problem. #houstonspacecenter #lunarsoil #apollo11 #spacecenter #nasa #naturalscience #museum #texas

item.title: Spring in WA
item.description: Celebrated #spring #bloom in #seattle with #tulips #hotairballoon #cherryblossom #lavendar and #tractor. #blooming #blooms #flowers #skagitvalley #tulipfestival #hotairballoons #springflowers #washingtonstate

item.title: Poo Poo Point
item.description: An interestingly named #trail leading to a vantage point of #gliders and #mountrainier - #poopoopoint #hike #issaquah #bellevue #seattle #adventuretime #adventure #washingtonstatehiking #washingtonstate #usa

item.title: Outstanding Olympic Peninsula
item.description: The #olympicpeninsula known for diversity of its distinct ecosystems and n number of tourist spots. Also contains #forks the #twilightsaga town. #rialtobeach #lapush #holeinthewall #solduchotsprings #hotsprings #twilightmovie #lakecrescent

item.title: Hiking Teneriffe Falls
item.description: Go to the sasta #waterfall when you don't have the energy to #summit the peak! #teneriffe #mountteneriffe #trek #trekking #hiking #i90corridor #northbend #washington #washingtonstate #washingtonhikersandclimbers #washingtonhikes

item.title: Long Angeles Tour
item.description: Nothing gets more glamorous than Los Angeles and Malibu. #losangeles #la #hollywood #southerncali #southerncalifornia #beverlyhills #rodeodrive #malibu #billionairelifestyle #california

item.title: Sunny San Diego
item.description: Retirement location successfully identified at the land of 300+ sunshine days along amazing Mexican food and Mexican-Coke @ LaJolla and San Diego

item.title: Deep Death Valley
item.description: Death Valley NP hosts out of the world martian landscapes and is a land of extremes, renowned for being the hottest, driest, and lowest national park in North America, with temperatures reaching record highs and locations below sea level.

item.title: Marvellous Mojave Dunes
item.description: Chasing a sunset is always rewarding, be it over a sea of water or a sea of sand in the Mojave Desert of the MacOS wallpaper fame.

item.title: Jolly Joshua
item.description: Weird flora like twisted and bristled Joshua Trees along with barbed cholla cacti somehow blooming in the desert. The name of the national park is derived from distinctive Joshua Tree, a tall-growing variety of the yucca genus that grows prevalently within its boundaries.

item.title: Tree Climbing in Lopez Island
item.description: Celebrated my birth anniversary by reliving the lives of our ape ancestors and climbing 100+ feet trees. Nandita and I have a tradition of gifting each other experiences, than materialistic stuff

item.title: Snowshoeing Mount Rainier
item.description: Lucky clear day with 100+ km visibility, enabled us to stand face to face with the majestic Mount Rainier that too in winter with views of the other 3 volcanoes: Mount St. Helens, Mt. Adams and Mt. Hood

item.title: Snowshoeing Artists Point
item.description: Less than a year back we did Artists point during peak summer. This time, it was time for peak winter and try our "legs" at the snow-shoeing

item.title: Wonderful Wallace Falls
item.description: We can never predict what we would encounter on our travels. This one in particular comprised of a series of three major waterfalls on the Wallace River â€“ called Lower, Middle, and Upper â€“ as well as some intermediate cascades along the way. The magical aspect however was not just seeing the waterfalls, but a surprisingly magical view of Olympics during the hike.

item.title: Ravishing Redwoods
item.description: Redwood National Park is known for its massive and super tall coastal redwood trees, being home to the worldâ€™s oldest redwood groves and the worldâ€™s tallest tree. Walking amongst these giants makes you feel tiny and a part of something bigger at the same time. A good lesson to start the new year with?

item.title: Stellar South Oregon
item.description: It's new year's eve and a long weekend. How can we not utilize and make it special. We initially planned to explore east Oregon but given hazardous snow conditions we changed our plans to south oregon and it couldn't have been more special. We played on snow, drove ATV on sand dunes, chilled on beaches and hiked through redwood rainforests - can it get more diverse?

item.title: Icy Icicle Ridge
item.description: Okay so its Winter in Washington but hey it's a sunny day and that means hiking day!! While the entire trail is 29.6 miles long, we opted to take the shorter Icicle Ridge loop hike which is around 6 miles and gives us an opportunity to unplug and connect with nature.

item.title: Numinous NYC
item.description: Sometimes been called the capital of the world, New York City is definitely the cultural, financial, and media capital of the world. From Bollywood to Hollywood, I''ve grown up seeing the city so much on screen that I had been looking to visit it in person for over alteast 10 years! Even after coming to the USA in Aug 2019, I had to wait for over 2 years to finally visit this, and it was nothing short of a surreal and emotional experience!

item.title: Bustling Boston
item.description: Finally, the fourth and final stop in my long new england road trip was the capital of Massachusetts and the gateway to New England - Boston which is a city of history and tradition having strong link to the countryâ€™s founding! With all the time with nature in the foilage trip before, this big city stop was just perfect before visiting uhm, NYC.

item.title: Heavenly Hamsphire
item.description: Moving along from Vermont in our New Englang road trip, the next state to conquer is New Hamsphire which is home to the White Mountains which we heard have HIT PEAK COLORS! Fall in New Hampshire is a foliage loverâ€™s dream come true

item.title: Vibrant Vermont
item.description: The beauty and splendor of a Vermont autumn has attained mythical status when it comes to sightseeing, atmosphere and must-do adventures. I had obsessed over foliage colors for more than a year with my first tryst with it at smokey mountains, and now coming to Vermont just taking my obsession to next level, with me micro-planning things and tracking foliage reports for over 2 months daily - just to catch 'peak colors'. Finally, the time was here and I'd say we reached at a pretty good time with thrilling carpet of colors blanketing the mountains, forests, and fields!

item.title: Mt. Greylock & The Berkshires
item.description: A New England Fall trip was on the top of my travel since forever. And this region is totally MADE for the autumn season, and every fall activity you could dream of can be found here, with a backdrop of brilliant foliage and quaint little towns. Finally, stars aligned and I was starting the long trip around the country side from the rolling hills of Massachusetts''s Berkshires, along with the highest point in the state - Mount Greylock!

item.title: Fascinating Fremont Lookout
item.description: It''s late September with not a lot of sunny days, so when we saw the weather prediction of a clear cloudless day - a hike was a no brainer. And what''s a more special hike than the Majestic Mount Rainier? So we woke up 3am in the morning, hoping to catch Sunrise at the aptly named Sunrise Region in Mount Rainier National Park!

item.title: Talapus Olallie Lakes
item.description: Encompassing area close to 400k acres, The Alpine Lakes Wilderness got its name from the 700+ mountain lakes found amongst the majestic rocky peaks and densely forested hillsides of the central Cascades. With about 50 official trailheads and 600+ miles of backcountry trails in the area, we managed to find a trail to see 2 of the many lakes along with some solitude time.

item.title: Oregon Coast
item.description: It was the labor day long weekend which also calls in for a looooong road trip! We're in the PNW so what's a better road trip than Oregon coast defined by the great sheer cliffs and rugged landscapes!

item.title: Rattling Rattlesnake
item.description: Rattlesnake ledge trail is one of the most popular hiking trails in Seattle and it is perfect for as a Seattle day hike. Not a sunny day, but we really wanted to do a hike and Rattlesnake ledge hike is a great cloudy day hike with possibilities to see cloud inversion if lucky!

item.title: Boisterous Baker
item.description: Another active glacier-covered volcano in the Cascade Volcanic Arc, Mount Baker is one of the snowiest places in the world. And now that summer if almost ending and with all the snow melted, we felt safe to go and do a hike in the area.

item.title: Pristine Snow Lake
item.description: The Alpine Lakes Wilderness showcases some of the most astonishing terrain in the entire Cascade Range. More than 700 lakes and mountain ponds dot the glacier-carved terrain of this wilderness. Since it is too risky to it in snow, due to avalanche risk, we decided to hike the most famous Snow Lake!

item.title: Hiking Little Si
item.description: It was peak PNW summer and we were feeling withdrawal symptoms from not doing a hike and missing the summer sun. So I scrambled my hiking boots, called up hiking buddies and decided to summit Little Si - a little sister to Mount Si.

item.title: Paradise in Rainier
item.description:
Mount Rainier is famous for providing a stunning backdrop to the skyline of Seattle, and I've always looked forward to the volcano as a pilgrimage. So a hike on this mountain was a surreal experience for me, with a major bucket list item getting checked off!
It is famously said "OF ALL the fire-mountains which, like beacons, once blazed along the Pacific coast, Mount Rainier is the noblest"

item.title: Keep Portland Weird
item.description: Portland in Oregon is known the world over as one of the sweetest, friendliest, and most charming cities in the United States. Being just 2 hours drive from our home base Seattle, why leave it unexplored?

item.title: Hurricane Ridge
item.description: The Olympic National Park encompasses several distinctly different ecosystems, including glacier-capped mountains, old-growth temperate rain forests, and over 70 miles of wild coastline.

item.title: Northern Cascades
item.description: With glacier-clad peaks rising almost vertically from thickly forested valleys, the North Cascades are often called the American Alps. With us skipping any sorts of hike, it was a pure road trip, winding our way through jagged mountain peaks, rocky spires, rushing waterfalls and alpine glacier on the North Cascades Scenic Byway.

item.title: Oyster Dome Trail
item.description: On Chuckanut Mountains and overlooking the San Juan Islands, with views all the way to the Olympics, Oyster Dome provides an opportunity for some gorgeous scenery. Been quite some time since I've hiked in the PNW, so let's go?

item.title: Fabulous Vegas
item.description: Set in the middle of the Mojave desert of Nevada, Las Vegas- the Entertainment Capital of the World, can seem unreal at first sight - it is a prime example of man's stubbornness to build this mammoth of a city in super inhospitable environment. Nicknamed Sin City, Las Vegas and its surrounding communities are famed for their mega-casino resorts, often lavishly decorated with names and themes meant to evoke romance, mystery, and exotic destinations

item.title: Zion Narrows
item.description: The final stop in our American south west trip was the mecca of desert slot canyons - The Zion Narrows, which has been rated one of the top ten hikes on Earth, and rightfully so. It is Zion National Park's hallmark hike. Here 18 million years of river erosion has cut 1500-foot walls into the earth and for many, hiking The Narrows is a life-changing experience.

item.title: Bryce Amphitheater
item.description: Hoodoos (irregular columns of rock) exist on every continent, but here in Bryce Canyon, which technically is not a canyon, is the largest concentration found anywhere on Earth. It is a series of natural amphitheaters or bowls, carved into the edge of the high Paunsaugunt plateau.

item.title: Antelope Canyon Kayak
item.description: The Antelope Canyon is arguably one of the most famous slot canyons in the world. The incredible canyon has been created over millions of years by the relentless forces of water and wind, slowly carving and sculpting the sandstone into forms, textures, and shapes which we observe today

item.title: Graaand Canyon
item.description: The Grand Canyon is one of the most dramatic and iconic features on Earth. It is beyond anything humans could fabricate and we visited the South Rim of the National park, which leaves all the awesomeness to Mother Nature!

item.title: Lake 22
item.description: Lake 22 trail, might just be the most beautiful trail in washington and the trail is truly something incredible and is a loop youâ€™ll never forget! We strategically came to the trek to see some snow on/near the lake but not too much of snow as it will just make the trek difficult!

item.title: PCH Big Sur
item.description: Considered one of the world''s most scenic drives, the Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) is a classic American road trip. I am not much of a driving enthusiast but missing this road trip will would be a sin!

item.title: The Bay Area
item.description: Known for culture, music, diversity, tech, and picturesque views, San Francisco is an eclectic city to visit. The city is super cosmopolitan and I was amazed by the diversity the city has to offer.

item.title: Spectacular Tahoe
item.description: Shaped during the ice ages and straddled between the state lines of California and Nevada, Lake Tahoe is the largest alpine lake in North America and also one of the deepest! About four hours by car from San Francisco, it served as our perfect weekend getaway!

item.title: Skagit Tulip Festival
item.description: One of the favorite destination events for the Pacific Northwest is the tulip festival in Skagit valley. Every spring hundreds of thousands of people from across the United States and from around the world come to enjoy the celebration of spring as millions of tulips burst into bloom - how could we miss this?

item.title: Lake Wenatchee
item.description: It was a month in Seattle and we had made a small ''gang'' of our own in Seattle! And what''s a better way to get to know each other than a trip? We decided to go and see the famous Lake Wenatchee before all the snow melted.

item.title: Dashing Titlow
item.description: I came to Seattle more than 3 weeks ago but spent most of the time (weekends) setting up the house. Finally, there came a weekend where things were in order and we couls step out and start exploring the famous pacific north west.

item.title: Wah Taj!
item.description: The capital of the Mughal Empire, the glorious city of Agra is less than 3 hours drive from Delhi, and made the perfect destination for a weekend getaway with extended family. The first time in my 25 years of existence, when EVERYONE went on a trip together - missing no one!

item.title: Back2Home
item.description: After a lot of cancelled plans, I was finally back home in India after about one a half year and in the middle of a pandemic it felt surreal. But I had more than 2 months of holidays, and plans to just stay home and relax :)

item.title: Commencement 2020
item.description: Surprisingly, even though it marks the end of college, the graduation ceremony in the USA is called commencement, because it marks the beginning of students new lives in the world - the beginning of their professional life. We consider ourselves lucky that our ceremony was one of the few and first ceremonies happening in COVID times!

item.title: Spring/Music/JD City
item.description: We had elaborate and grand plans to do a road trip across the east coast of USA before graduating but COVID had other plans, so we switched plans to exploring our neighbor Tennessee and boy it was amazing. Spring city, served as a good socially-distant camp to explore the nearby Nashville and Lynchburg!

item.title: Providence Canyon
item.description: Exactly a week from graduation and the tempo to travel at the highest, I just came to know about Georgiaâ€™s "Little Grand Canyon" - how could we have missed that? Practically my last trip in Georgia (as a student ;))

item.title: Emerald Panama City
item.description: I was graduating in less than two weeks when I realized that I'll be leaving the South East USA for good, and that we have left lot of places unvisited thanks to COVID. So I ramped up the touring plans and the first stop was Panama City Beach's who's slogan is 'The World's Most Beautiful Beaches' due to the spectacular white sand and glistening emerald green waters!

item.title: Finale @ Tech
item.description: My time at Georgia Tech, and especially the last semester went by way too fast thanks to COVID-19! The last semester on campus might not have went the way I had originally planned in my mind because of the pandemic, but i did try my best to make the most out of the time I had left in Atlanta and create cherishable memories along with long lasting friendships!

item.title: Smoky Halloween
item.description: The magnificent range of the Appalachians ranks among the greatest foilage destinations in the country, making Octoberâ€”justifiably one of the most popular times to visit. It''s also a great way to have a socially distanced vacation during COVID times, so bring it on!

item.title: Athens via Yargo
item.description: After learning to drive, we decided to take our first inter-city trip to Athens. Situated perfectly halfway between the two cities, Fort Yargo stare park serves as the best pit-stop!

item.title: Summer, Spring & COVID
item.description: First identified in December 2019 in Wuhan (China) the coronavirus has wrecked havoc all across the world with more than 2 million worldwide deaths. The world seems to have come to a stop with global social and economic disruption, including the largest global recession since the Great Depression!

item.title: Laborious Panther Creek
item.description: For the extended weekend due to labor day, what's better than a laborious 7-mile adventure in the Chattahoochee National Forest in Northern Georgia?

item.title: Stone Mountain Hike
item.description: Stone Mountain is the largest bas-relief sculpture in the world and is incorrectly dubbed as the largest exposed piece of granite in the world. It is also the most visited destination in the state of Georgia! Although most of the recreational activities were closed because of the coronavirus pandemic, hiking is probably the safest form of excursion in these times.

item.title: Hilton Head Island
item.description: Just across Georgia's border lies Hilton Head Island in South Carolina. It is a vacation playland with famous beaches and great golf courses that overlook the Atlantic Ocean. However during COVID-19 times, the fun was ofcourse super limited. Our trip was mainly about the drive, and probably to get some fresh air after ending our internships!

item.title: Great Smoky Mountains
item.description: Straddled between the borders of Tennessee and North Carolina, the Great Smoky Mountain National Park is the most visited national park in the United States and one of the largest protected areas on the east coast. With our planned Miami trip cancelled due the novel coronavirus, one desperately needed some solace to vent out the frustation :P.

item.title: Chilly Tech!
item.description: Coming from the Indian subcontinent, even Atlanta's winter with sub zero temperatures is uncomfortably cold for me! This gives us a super chilly start to a new 'Spring Semester' and probably the coldest New Year''s eve yet.

item.title: Haunted Savannah
item.description: Georgia's oldest city and the birthplace of the state, Savannah has great historic importance. Also, the city is touted as one of Americaâ€™s most haunted cities. With one of the largest historic district centre in the country, the city is famous for its numerous and elaborate public squares.

item.title: Pine Mountain Hike
item.description: What's a more refreshing way to start the semester, month, year and decade with a hike! Located not too far from the GT campus and nestled amongst the mountains in Northern Georgia is the scenic hike of Pine Mountain.

item.title: Universal at Hollywood
item.description: The original Universal Studios at Hollywood is aptly called ''The Entertainment Capital of LA'' is one of the oldest and most famous Hollywood film studios still in use. It is also the world's largest motion picture studio!

item.title: Adventure in California
item.description: Themed after the history and culture of California, Disney''s California Adventure Park celebrates ''adventure of the state'' through various Disney characters. Guess you just come here and you have seen the best of California at one place?

item.title: Magical Land of Disney
item.description: Visiting the original Disneyland, opened well over half a century ago was always a dream. Walt Disney famously said "To all who come to this happy place, welcome. Disneyland is your land. Here age relives fond memories of the past, and here youth may savor the challenge and promise of the future."

item.title: Lavish Los Angeles
item.description: Los Angeles literally translates to "The Angels" from Spanish. Famous for the entertainment industry, the city is just a drive away from snow-capped mountains, desert and beach making it a dream city for me. I was in LA for about 10 days and with so much to see, the time still seemed less :D. Seperate posts for DisneyLand and Universal Studios.

item.title: Fall @ GaTech
item.description: The first semester is coming to an end - everyone is busy studying with the campus being deserted. But luckily, I don't have exams this semester - giving me the perfect opportunity to capture pictures of the campus with minimal disturbance by other creatures.

item.title: Unexpected Atlanta
item.description: Atlanta, the capital of the US state of Georgia is my temporary home for about 2 years during my Master's. The ignorant me never cared about the city before GeorgiaTech happened. As it turns out, the city is quite integral and important part of the economy and culture with HQs of Coca Cola, CNN, ATT, BoFA and having hosted Summer Olympics even before I was born.

item.title: Grinding Grad School
item.description: Everyone knows and expects that graduate school is tough, but trust me that it's harder and stressful than you think it is. Very different from my experience in Europe, colleges in the USA, I guess are probably worth all the hype.

item.title: Farewell India?
item.description:
Time to start graduate school also meant a lot of goodbyes! I met over 30-40 people over last 2 months and am greatful to all! *sobs uncontrollably*.
PS- I also met a lot of other people but forgot to take pictures! Sorry Divyanshu, Lakshay, Dhanur, GT@Bglore meetup and soooo many more people.

item.title: Detox @ Naukuchiatal
item.description: Away from the hustle of Nainital, Naukuchiatal is a secluded hill station, perfect for a family trip where the motivation is not see as much as possible but relax as much as possible.

item.title: Wine Tasting at Kadu
item.description: After a stressful MS in USA admission season, what's better than lightening the mood with some wine tasting? My last official trip in Bangalore, with guests from Mumbai and Hyderabad!

item.title: Blissful Bangkok
item.description: Our second stop in Thailand trip is Bangkok - one of the Asia's most cosmopolitan cities with magnificent temples and palaces, authentic canals, busy markets and a vibrant nightlife that has something for everyone.

item.title: Phenomenal Phuket
item.description: A trip to Thailand is definitely on the bucket list of every Indian and I was fortunate to do this on my 23rd birthday. The plan was pretty spontaneous with all of us getting leave from work during the same time. In the short 6 days trip we covered all the major tourist spots - Phuket, Krabi and Bangkok.

item.title: Ruins of Hampi
item.description: After 5 long weeks of no travelling, we decided to explore Hampi - the capital of Vijayagara empire and one of the famous UNESCO World Heritage Site of South India. It also happened to be the second-largest medieval-era city after Beijing.

item.title: Mysore Dasara
item.description: The city of Mysore has a long tradition of celebrating the Dasara festival with grandeur and pomp to mark the festival. The fact that we were just about 150km away in Banagalore, it would have been a sin to miss this.

item.title: Arduous Kodachadri
item.description: After being postponed a hundred times and amid the risk of a cyclone, we the "fresh graduates" at Tesco Bengaluru set our minds to scale the Kodachadri Hill. The Kodachadri trek is probably one of the best treks in the Western Ghats which offers a 16km one-way hike, flat grasslands, waterfalls, jeep ride and the amazing view of the Arabian Sea - all wonderfully packed in one adventure.

item.title: Hike to Chennagiri
item.description: Set amidst the amazing Nandi Hills, we chose to start the month of September on a 'high note' by climbing the Chennagiri Hill. Owing to our inexperience, the 7 of us went along with other hikers led by the people from @Wanderophile.

item.title: Convocation @ BPGC
item.description: The convocation day brings with itself a roller coaster of emotions and is a time for celebration and joy. The time when the grads don the graduation gown and wear the mortarboards as a sign of (academic) excellence. It is without a doubt, one of the most important moments in a person's life.

item.title: Steep Trek to Savandurga
item.description: We chose Savandurga - the largest monolith in Asia, as our first trek location, after shifting to Bangalore and starting our corporate lives. Situated about 70km from the city it makes a perfect location for an adventurous trek.

item.title: Backwaters at Alleppey
item.description: The Venice of the East - Alleppey was chosen as the destination for our trip together after 3 years post quite a struggle and ponder over multiple destinations in South India. The three of us went for our first independant trip to shimla just 5 months after the start of our engineering; and now we hit the road again, just 5 months before we get our degrees - conincidence much?

item.title: Indo-French Pondy
item.description: The largest French Colony in India, Pondicherry, was a nostalgic trip for me - after staying in France for about 4 months. I did try some of the French that I learned - but only to fail :(

item.title: Adventurous Malvan
item.description: Malvan, the fisihing coast town of Maharashtra is famous for scuba diving and water sports because of its clear waters - making it a perfect weekend getaway.

item.title: New Year @ Tito Goa
item.description: Almost every Indian has a dream of celebrating the New Year at the party capital of India- Goa. Since this was the last year of me as a student in Goa, it was about time to live that dream.

item.title: Relaxing in Himachal
item.description: Coming back from a 4 months long EU trip on the 4th December, I had no energy/mood to go anywhere but a relaxing trip in the laps of Himalayas, just before the starting of crazy placement process seemed like a good idea :P

item.title: Farewell Montpellier
item.description:
Okay so I don't typically do this, but I met such nice and kind people here and I miss them so much that I really need to do this post. I have learned so much from each one of them. I am not much of a selfie person and that's probably the reason that I don't have a picture with eveyrone I met BUT if we met in Montpellier, trust me that you have inspired me in some way or the other. THANK YOU so much (and sorry if we didn't click a picture together :( )
WIll miss everyone.

item.title: More of Montpellier
item.description: Has been so long in Montpellier. Deserves another post right?

item.title: Gaudi's Barcelona
item.description: The largest city in Catalonia, Spain is best known for the works of Antoni GaudÃ­ apart from being a major cultural heritage.

item.title: Cannes
item.description: Known for the annual Cannes Film Festival, Midem, and Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity. Also known for its association with the rich and famous, its luxury hotels and restaurants, and for several conferences

item.title: The 'Nice' French Riviera
item.description: Located in the French Riviera, on the south east coast of France on the Mediterranean Sea, at the foot of the Alps, Nice is the second-largest French city on the Mediterranean coast. This coastline was one of the first modern resort areas. It began as a winter health resort for the British upper class at the end of the 18th century.

item.title: Bond's Monaco
item.description:
Monaco is the second smallest and the most densely populated country in the world with over a third of its population being millionaires. Even after multiple land reclamation projects its just over 2km square - the funny part being it's just over 5 times of my otherwise considered tiny college campus.
PS- We walked the country's width on foot in less than half an hour.

item.title: Amsterdam, the city of freedom?
item.description: Amsterdam is colloquially known as Venice of the North because of its lovely canals that criss-cross the city, its impressive architecture and more than 1,500 bridges.

item.title: Brussels - The European capital
item.description: Brussels, the de facto capital of the European Union was one of the most multilingual cities I have ever witnessed. Most of people spoke all of English, French and Dutch fluently.

item.title: Nimes - The French Rome
item.description: Definitely the best place to experience the Roman Heritage in France.

item.title: Paris - World's Fashion Capital
item.description: The following conversation in the film 'Midnight in Paris' aptly summarises my feelings about Paris - the most visited city in the world

item.title: Mediterranean Montpellier
item.description: So here comes another internship (Bachelor's Thesis) and another country. It's continental Europe and SOUTH OF FRANCE this time. Montpellier is on the Mediterranean coast experiences a much warmer climate than rest of France (thank god!). It's a student city with more than a third of the popuation being students. And yes, I don't know French so it's hell of a problem.

item.title: Buh bye Dublin
item.description: So here comes to end my first "international trip". I couldn't travel outside of Ireland (even to the northern part :() thanks to the visa restrictions, but I am proud to have travelled a lot in Ireland and made so many new friends. I'll surely miss the super hospitable and ever smiling nature of the Irish. It was a great experience, both at work and culturally. Wouldn't think twice before coming to Dublin again.

item.title: Cork and its Vikings
item.description: As my days in Ireland were coming to a (sad) end, I quickly decided to see rhe rebel city, Cork and the Rock Of Cashel before I leave :D

item.title: Pretty Little 'Galway' girl
item.description: Galway, also famously called as the city of tribes was my first stop outside of Dublin in my "EuroTrip"

item.title: Dublin - The Beer Capital?
item.description: So as it turns out, Dublin - the capital of the small island nation, Ireland is my first international destination. I am here for a summer internship at CeADAR (Dublin Institute of Technology) for about 9 weeks. Suuuuuuper excited.

item.title: Farewell @ BPGC
item.description: So as it turns out, we at BITS, get our farewell in the end of 3rd itself - even when the course spans 4 years. Here's to seeing everyone on campus for the last time.

item.title: Google Developer's Group
item.description: Google Developers Group are local groups of developers who are specifically interested in Google products and APIs. Upon digging out I found out that our campus had GDG chapter until 2013 but was abruptly discountinued. Hence, along with @AbhimanyuSinghShekhawat I took the initiative of restarting that. We had our first event on October 10, 2016 followed by another event on March 18, 2017.

item.title: Short Trip to Mumbai
item.description: I scheduled my GRE and appointment for Visa at Ireland on consecutive days which were both supposed to take place in Mumbai which enabled me to visit the city of dreams :)

item.title: Fisherman's Wharf
item.description: Probably the last outing when everyone from "Killogicals" together. We decided to go to Fisherman's Wharf - the famous authentic Goan cuisine restaurant chain.

item.title: Arambol Beach
item.description: Arambol is the northenmost beach of Goa which is pretty pristine and naturally attracts a lot of foreignours.

item.title: Agonda Beach
item.description: Agonda beach is consistently ranked as the top beaches to visit in India and is also a popular for being the nesting ground for turtles.

item.title: Birthday @ BBQ
item.description: That time of the year which your friends wait for - not for wishing you but to beat the shit of you.

item.title: Jaisalmer & Thar Desert
item.description: Jaisalmer, apty called "The Golden city" is situated in the heart of the Thar Desert in Rajasthan. "Winters" is probably the only time when it's feasible to go to this super hot part of the country. This part of the desert is also famous for the picturesque sand dunes.

item.title: Waves 2k15
item.description: The theme for the 2015 Edition of Waves was "Escape Reality". The time of the year when we get relief from our otherwise jam-packed academic schedule

item.title: Killogicals Unite @ BBQ
item.description: Killogicals' first mega treat happened at BBQ@Panjim. My first BBQ experience, for which I starved myself for over 24hrs :P

item.title: Kesarval Spring
item.description: The kesarval spring is known to have many medicinal properties and luckily it was at a short distance from our campus - making it a ideal picnic spot for us

item.title: Chapora & Vagator
item.description: The Chapora fort is around 500 years old and sits in a commanding poition with views in all diection. It was rebuilt and changed hand several times even before the Potugese came to Goa.

item.title: Kashmir - Paradise on Earth
item.description: Kashmir, rightly called as Paradise on earth is located in the northernmost state of India admist the mighty Himalayas. We decided to visit the heaven in summer's because it' intolerably cold otherwise and covered with snow.

item.title: Pristine Palolem
item.description: Palolem Beach is one of the most unspoiled beach I have ever been to India. Being very far down south, not many people flock here which instantly makes it my favorite beach.

item.title: First B'day at BITS
item.description: The first birthday on campus. Not sure if one should be excited about the celebration or scared about the GPL (birthday-bombs) that come free with it.

item.title: New Year @ Shimla
item.description: The summer capital of British India, Shimla is one of the top tourist desitnation especially for the people of North India. Being not verrrry far from Delhi it turned out to be my first trip with friends (which was totally planned by us with no outside intervention :P).

item.title: Uttorda Beach
item.description: Uttorda is one of the most exotic beaches in Goa, an ideal place for a relaxing evening

item.title: Netravali Fall Trek
item.description: 2014 is the first year of college and whats a better way to bond than going on an excursion together with the whole lot from the hostel? We decided to trek to the Savari Waterfall at Netrvali Wildlife Sanctuary.

item.title: Majorda Beach
item.description: Majorda, one of the prettiest beaches in South Goa was selected for our first outing together by my "corridor-mates"

item.title: Init Goa
item.description: So here starts 4 years long vacation at Goa because of my admission into BITS Pilani, Goa Campus,

item.title: Short Trip to Hyderabad
item.description: In the season of college admissions, I applied to IIIT-Hyderabad through KVPY and was called upon for an interview which led to me visiting the capital of Andhra Pradesh for the first time.

item.title: Gwalior
item.description: Papa joined a new company, Cadbury's which led him to shift to Gwalior - new city = new adventures.

item.title: Coorg via Mysore
item.description: Wellknown for its breathtakingly exotic scenery, Coorg was also famously called as the "Scotland of India" by the Britishers. It is famous for its Coffee plantations. Since Papa was based in Bangalore, we drove to Coorg via Mysore.

item.title: Bangalore
item.description: Wellknown for its breathtakingly exotic scenery, Coorg was also famously called as the "Scotland of India" by the Britishers. It is famous for its Coffee plantations. Since Papa was based in Bangalore, we drove to Coorg via Mysore.

item.title: Royal Jaipur
item.description: The Pink City of India, Jaipur is a is a popular tourist and stratrgic destination which serves as the gateway to Rajasthan.

item.title: Celebrations at DPSG
item.description: Our beloved school extravagantly organizes a cultural function and exhibition annually with participation of more than 2000 students (*coughs* mandatory 100% participation *coughs*)

item.title: Forts of Rajasthan
item.description: This trip was all about the mewar kingdom and the achievements of the mighty rajputs as we covered multiple places of interest in Rajasthan, namely Udaipur, Kumbalgarh and Chittor starting our journey from Jaipur.
